Key Arguments: The legislation contradicts Australian democratic principles and human rights, particularly freedom of speech.
The bill could penalize individuals with views opposing the government, stifling free expression.
The legislation may perpetuate fear and discourage critical thinking and debate.
There is concern over who will determine what constitutes misinformation and the potential for government bias.
The bill could increase division among Australians.
The government has previously spread misinformation, raising doubts about its ability to regulate truth.
Notable Quotes: This Bill represents a threat to the freedom of all Australians to voice their own opinions, should they not be in line with Government narratives.
You can not arrive at a truth until there has been critical analysis of the beliefs of others.
